channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: For Trump, 'America First' has meant an aggressive use of power in foreign policy
item.description: In his first year back in office, President Trump has made clear that America First is far from isolationist, instead it means aggressive use of the country's unilateral power around the world.
item.content:encoded: In his first year back in office, President Trump has made clear that America First is far from isolationist, instead it means aggressive use of the country's unilateral power around the world.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Former ambassador talks about Trump's foreign policy approach during his second term
item.description: Wendy Sherman, a former ambassador who has served under three presidential administrations, analyzes President Trump's approach to foreign policy this year.
item.content:encoded: Wendy Sherman, a former ambassador who has served under three presidential administrations, analyzes President Trump's approach to foreign policy this year.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Pope Leo XIV calls for a ceasefire in all conflicts in first Christmas Mass
item.description: Thousands of people gathered in Bethlehem's Manger Square as Pope Leo XIV celebrated his first Christmas Mass and called for a ceasefire in all conflicts this Christmas.
item.content:encoded: Thousands of people gathered in Bethlehem's Manger Square as Pope Leo XIV celebrated his first Christmas Mass and called for a ceasefire in all conflicts this Christmas.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem, Trump-backed conservative candidate wins Honduras' presidential election, a look at how Trump's immigration policies have affected families this year.
item.content:encoded: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem, Trump-backed conservative candidate wins Honduras' presidential election, a look at how Trump's immigration policies have affected families this year.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Padma Lakshmi's 'All American' cookbook highlights recipes from immigrant communities
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel and chef Padma Lakshmi make recipes from Lakshmi's book, "Padma's All American," which highlights foods made by immigrant communities that are also perfect for the holidays.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel and chef Padma Lakshmi make recipes from Lakshmi's book, "Padma's All American," which highlights foods made by immigrant communities that are also perfect for the holidays.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: After two years, Bethlehem brings back it Christmas celebrations
item.description: With a ceasefire in place in Gaza, Bethlehem in the West Bank is resuming its festive Christmas celebrations.
item.content:encoded: With a ceasefire in place in Gaza, Bethlehem in the West Bank is resuming its festive Christmas celebrations.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: A group of Belgians make drones in a secret volunteer workshop to send to Ukraine
item.description: A group of hobbyists in Belgium make drones that help on the frontline of a war.
item.content:encoded: A group of hobbyists in Belgium make drones that help on the frontline of a war.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: How one politically divided family keeps the peace during the holidays
item.description: Talking about politics over the holidays can be difficult for many families, even for politicians themselves. One politically divided family in Colorado makes sure get along, especially during the holidays.
item.content:encoded: Talking about politics over the holidays can be difficult for many families, even for politicians themselves. One politically divided family in Colorado makes sure get along, especially during the holidays.
item.dc:creator: Bente Birkeland

item.title: A holiday tradition: David Sedaris reads from 'The Santaland Diaries'
item.description: Writer and humorist David Sedaris reads from his holiday essay "The Santaland Diaries."
item.content:encoded: Writer and humorist David Sedaris reads from his holiday essay "The Santaland Diaries."

item.title: How Trump's mass deportation efforts have affected families this year
item.description: The centerpiece of the Trump administration's second term has been mass deportations. NPR's Jasmine Garsd recaps how families and American children have been affected.
item.content:encoded: The centerpiece of the Trump administration's second term has been mass deportations. NPR's Jasmine Garsd recaps how families and American children have been affected.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd
